Description: Jowar, also known as sorghum, is a gluten-free grain with a chewy texture and mild flavor. It is commonly used as a staple food in India and Africa.
Ragi, also known as finger millet, is a nutritious grain rich in calcium, iron, and fiber. It has a slightly nutty flavor and is often used in porridge, flatbreads, and baked goods.
Uses: Flour for porridge, flatbreads, baked goods

Description: Foxtail millet is an ancient grain that is gluten-free and rich in fiber and minerals. It has a mild, nutty flavor and can be used in place of rice or oats in many dishes.
Barnyard millet is a gluten-free grain with a slightly sweet flavor. It is rich in fiber and minerals and can be used in various dishes such as porridge, upma, and pilaf.
